formattedAddress: 89 South St, New York, NY 10038, USA
adrFormatAddress: 89 South St, New York, NY 10038, USA

editorialSummary.text: Waterfront restaurant preparing a modern menu of wild-caught seafood paired with seasonal cocktails.

originalText.text: The Fulton was such an amazing culinary experience. Absolutely everything about the food was masterful in presentation and taste. On top of that, I would add that this is one of the most amazing locations, overlooking the Brooklyn bridge, at the Seaport and the interior design is incredible. Our server was very attentive to the menu and the food came out with great timing. I really wanted to give this restaurant 5 stars, but with the incredible experience above, it was unfortunately tarnished by the initial impression given by the host stand. I do admit, we did arrive with a +1 in our party, however, when interacting with the host and battling a 90+ decibel level main dining room where a 10+ person family was sat, I was given stark attitude, staring at me when I brought up the noise like I was talking another language, and even though the restaurant was 45% sat, we waited 15+ minutes to be seated. The food and everything else was that good to leave this at a 4 star review. Finally, to add some more feedback: the cocktails fell flat, the beer selection was amazing, we didn't get greeted by the bartender once while waiting at the bar, and the music (when the large party left) was pleasant. In conclusion, this experience we left as positive, with expectations in marketing and pricing, the feedback I am leaving above is to achieve perfection.

originalText.text: Divine! Everything was impeccably done. Loved the octopus & mozzarella appetizer. Salmon was perfectly cooked with a sublime consommé. And the Fulton cookie may look simple but it’s heavenly! Paired the meal with neat Reisling. It was a cold winter night but the cozy atmosphere made it romantic even though I was just with my friend.

text.text: Divine! Everything was impeccably done. Loved the octopus & mozzarella appetizer. Salmon was perfectly cooked with a sublime consommé. And the Fulton cookie may look simple but it’s heavenly! Paired the meal with neat Reisling. It was a cold winter night but the cozy atmosphere made it romantic even though I was just with my friend.

originalText.text:
It marked our second anniversary, and I aimed for perfection. Initially, I had booked the atrium, believing it offered the best view. However, Mariah from The Fulton Reservation Team shared a valuable insight, suggesting that the Dining Room on the second floor had a superior ambiance and view for an anniversary celebration. Following her advice, she graciously moved our reservation to a table in the Dining Room on the second floor.

Upon arrival, the reception staff kindly informed us that with a short wait, they could offer us a table with an even better view. Eager for the optimal experience, we agreed to wait. The patience paid off when we were seated at a table with an incredible view, capturing the beauty of the both Brooklyn and Manhattan bridges and the Brooklyn skyline perfectly.

The culinary experience was nothing short of perfection, earning a solid 10/10. It was undeniably the best seafood meal I have had in New York. The service was exceptional, further enhancing our overall satisfaction. While I acknowledge that the prices were on the higher side, the unparalleled view, impeccable service, and outstanding food more than justified the cost.

I am genuinely delighted that we chose The Fulton for our anniversary celebration, and I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone seeking a restaurant for a special occasion. A sincere thank you for providing us with an amazing and memorable experience!

originalText.text:
The beautiful restaurant locate near Brooklyn bridge. The food taste is not good for me. Steak is good but side dish and salad are unsatisfied. May be they are not my favorate style. The staff service is great. They feel that I did not like the salad and ask me for change the new one.
"Impressive"

originalText.text:
1 The food is delicious and tastes good. Today is my birthday and we brought our own cake to celebrate. Turns out the cost for us to cut the cake was $10 per person. We were charged $40 to cut the cake (what a joke) . It's a small thing, birthdays are all about being happy.
2 But unfortunately, my scarf may have fallen under the chair when I left. Then I took my gift and cake and left the store. After I got home, I looked for that scarf for a long time until my friend found out that it was mybirthday. The scarf in the photo I just realized that in the second photo of us leaving, I don’t have the scarf around my neck. The scarf may not be very expensive , but it is an attitude. When we ate at this restaurant, we didn’t just walk in. We made a reservation and left my mobile phone number, but the restaurant didn’t contact me. Instead, I took the initiative to call and ask, which was too bad. So I will not eat there again in my life and I will not recommend it to my friends
